channel.title: Essential Tennis LIVE
channel.itunes:subtitle: Essential Tennis Live
channel.itunes:summary: LIVE tennis broadcast every Thursday evening at 8:30pm EST.
channel.itunes:author: Ian Westermann

item.title: Approaching the Net Correcly
item.dc:creator: ian@essentialtennis.com (Ian Westermann)
item.description: There are so many variables involved when coming up to the net in tennis. Some of them include: which direction to hit your approach, where to position yourself on the court, whether to hit topspin or slice, and where to hit your volley once you get up there. Listen to Ron and Ian discuss these [...]
item.content:encoded: There are so many variables involved when coming up to the net in tennis. Some of them include: which direction to hit your approach, where to position yourself on the court, whether to hit topspin or slice, and where to hit your volley once you get up there. Listen to Ron and Ian discuss these topics and more on today’s show!
item.itunes:subtitle: There are so many variables involved when coming up to the net in tennis. Some of them include: which direction to hit your approach, where ...
item.itunes:summary: There are so many variables involved when coming up to the net in tennis. Some of them include: which direction to hit your approach, where to position yourself on the court, whether to hit topspin or slice, and where to hit your volley once you get up there. Listen to Ron and Ian discuss these topics and more on today's show!
item.itunes:author: Ian Westermann

item.title: Creating a Game Plan
item.dc:creator: ian@essentialtennis.com (Ian Westermann)
item.description: Do you have a “plan A” and “plan B” when you head out onto the tennis court to play a match? Today Ron and Ian discuss how to create a game plan for your tennis matches, when to change it, and how to execute it correctly.
item.content:encoded: Do you have a “plan A” and “plan B” when you head out onto the tennis court to play a match? Today Ron and Ian discuss how to create a game plan for your tennis matches, when to change it, and how to execute it correctly.
item.itunes:subtitle: Do you have a "plan A" and "plan B" when you head out onto the tennis court to play a match? Today Ron and Ian ...
item.itunes:summary: Do you have a "plan A" and "plan B" when you head out onto the tennis court to play a match? Today Ron and Ian discuss how to create a game plan for your tennis matches, when to change it, and how to execute it correctly.
item.itunes:author: Ian Westermann

item.title: Men Versus Women: Battle of the Sexes
item.dc:creator: ian@essentialtennis.com (Ian Westermann)
item.description: Remember the “Battle of the Sexes” back in the 70′s that pitted Billie Jean King against Bobby Riggs? Is there any way that we could re-create that kind of buzz and excitement about our sport agian? How about men’s and women’s tennis in general, how are they matching up these days compared to each other? [...]
item.content:encoded: Remember the “Battle of the Sexes” back in the 70′s that pitted Billie Jean King against Bobby Riggs? Is there any way that we could re-create that kind of buzz and excitement about our sport agian? How about men’s and women’s tennis in general, how are they matching up these days compared to each other? Listen to Ron, Ian and three callers discuss these topics!
item.itunes:subtitle: Remember the "Battle of the Sexes" back in the 70's that pitted Billie Jean King against Bobby Riggs? Is there any way that we could ...
item.itunes:summary: Remember the "Battle of the Sexes" back in the 70's that pitted Billie Jean King against Bobby Riggs? Is there any way that we could re-create that kind of buzz and excitement about our sport agian? How about men's and women's tennis in general, how are they matching up these days compared to each other? Listen to Ron, Ian and three callers discuss these topics!
item.itunes:author: Ian Westermann

item.title: Stroke Focus: The Second Serve
item.dc:creator: ian@essentialtennis.com (Ian Westermann)
item.description: Tonight’s show is all about one of the least practiced shot in tennis: the second serve. What types of strategy do you use when deciding what type of second serve to hit? Have you ever tried just hitting two first serves? What types of technique should be used in order to hit a solid second [...]
item.content:encoded: Tonight’s show is all about one of the least practiced shot in tennis: the second serve. What types of strategy do you use when deciding what type of second serve to hit? Have you ever tried just hitting two first serves? What types of technique should be used in order to hit a solid second serve? Listen in to Ron and Ian discuss this topic!
item.itunes:subtitle: Tonight's show is all about one of the least practiced shot in tennis: the second serve. What types of strategy do you use when deciding ...
item.itunes:summary: Tonight's show is all about one of the least practiced shot in tennis: the second serve. What types of strategy do you use when deciding what type of second serve to hit? Have you ever tried just hitting two first serves? What types of technique should be used in order to hit a solid second serve? Listen in to Ron and Ian discuss this topic!
item.itunes:author: Ian Westermann

item.title: Inside Out and Inside In Forehand
item.dc:creator: ian@essentialtennis.com (Ian Westermann)
item.description: The inside out and inside out forehand have been used for quite some time by professionals and has become very popular in the game of tennis. Is it a good idea to continue avoiding your weaker side at all costs? When does it become a crutch or moving too far around your backhand? Listen to [...]
item.content:encoded: The inside out and inside out forehand have been used for quite some time by professionals and has become very popular in the game of tennis. Is it a good idea to continue avoiding your weaker side at all costs? When does it become a crutch or moving too far around your backhand? Listen to Ron and Ian discuss this topic with callers.
item.itunes:subtitle: The inside out and inside out forehand have been used for quite some time by professionals and has become very popular in the game of ...
item.itunes:summary: The inside out and inside out forehand have been used for quite some time by professionals and has become very popular in the game of tennis. Is it a good idea to continue avoiding your weaker side at all costs? When does it become a crutch or moving too far around your backhand? Listen to Ron and Ian discuss this topic with callers.
item.itunes:author: Ian Westermann

item.title: Starting Kids in Tennis
item.dc:creator: ian@essentialtennis.com (Ian Westermann)
item.description: When is old enough to begin your child playing tennis or taking lessons? Should you push your kids to play tennis or only have them play if they really want to? How about teaching your own kids, or should you get somebody else to instruct them? Listen to Ron, Ian, and several callers talk about [...]
item.content:encoded: When is old enough to begin your child playing tennis or taking lessons? Should you push your kids to play tennis or only have them play if they really want to? How about teaching your own kids, or should you get somebody else to instruct them? Listen to Ron, Ian, and several callers talk about little kids and tennis!
item.itunes:subtitle: When is old enough to begin your child playing tennis or taking lessons? Should you push your kids to play tennis or only have them ...
item.itunes:summary: When is old enough to begin your child playing tennis or taking lessons? Should you push your kids to play tennis or only have them play if they really want to? How about teaching your own kids, or should you get somebody else to instruct them? Listen to Ron, Ian, and several callers talk about little kids and tennis!
item.itunes:author: Ian Westermann

item.title: Saving Your Body for Tennis
item.dc:creator: ian@essentialtennis.com (Ian Westermann)
item.description: Most of us have dealt with some kind of injury or other over the course of our tennis careers. Is it worth it to model your game in such a way as to minimize pain and injury? Is there some way to play the game or work out in order to play as long as [...]
item.content:encoded: Most of us have dealt with some kind of injury or other over the course of our tennis careers. Is it worth it to model your game in such a way as to minimize pain and injury? Is there some way to play the game or work out in order to play as long as possible? Listen to Ron, Ian, and several callers talk about this topic.
item.itunes:subtitle: Most of us have dealt with some kind of injury or other over the course of our tennis careers. Is it worth it to model ...
item.itunes:summary: Most of us have dealt with some kind of injury or other over the course of our tennis careers. Is it worth it to model your game in such a way as to minimize pain and injury? Is there some way to play the game or work out in order to play as long as possible? Listen to Ron, Ian, and several callers talk about this topic.
item.itunes:author: Ian Westermann

item.title: Video and Tennis Improvement
item.dc:creator: ian@essentialtennis.com (Ian Westermann)
item.description: Do you use digital video to help improve your tennis game? What kinds of techniques should you use to create your videos and share them with the world? Listen to Ian and Ron discuss these topics and more!
item.content:encoded: Do you use digital video to help improve your tennis game? What kinds of techniques should you use to create your videos and share them with the world? Listen to Ian and Ron discuss these topics and more!

item.title: What Rackets Have You Owned?
item.dc:creator: ian@essentialtennis.com (Ian Westermann)
item.description: On tonight’s show we had a friendly discussion of rackets past, present, and future. Take a trip down memory lane with Ron, Ian, and callers as they discuss their favorite rackets of all time.
item.content:encoded: On tonight’s show we had a friendly discussion of rackets past, present, and future. Take a trip down memory lane with Ron, Ian, and callers as they discuss their favorite rackets of all time.

item.title: Using Stats to Improve Your Game
item.dc:creator: ian@essentialtennis.com (Ian Westermann)
item.description: Have you ever charted one of your own matches to see exactly what’s happening out on the court? You should! Today Ron and Ian talk about the use of statistics in both professional and amateur tennis matches. Which stats should you keep track of? Are some more important than others?
item.content:encoded: Have you ever charted one of your own matches to see exactly what’s happening out on the court? You should! Today Ron and Ian talk about the use of statistics in both professional and amateur tennis matches. Which stats should you keep track of? Are some more important than others?
